title: Funding opportunity: Collaborative doctoral landscape award in the arts and humanities
description: Last updated: 29 May 2025 - see all updates UK non-higher education institutions (non-HEI), individual organisations or consortia, can apply to become arts and humanities collaborative doctoral landscape award grant holders to support and provide high-quality doctoral training. AHRC will support up to 50 doctoral studentships per year, for four years through this scheme. You can apply for a minimum of three students per year (two in exceptional circumstances). Doctoral projects must align with the organisationâ€™s priorities and are undertaken with a university partner.
